bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 87 (Friday, May 8, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. WILD:H.R. 6797.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:U.S. CON. STAT. Art. 1, Sec. 8., Cl. 1, 3, and 18.[Page H1987]

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.fullName: Rep. San Nicolas, Michael F. Q. [D-GU-At Large]

item.name: Emergency medical services and trauma care

item.text:
Children's Health Insurance Program Pandemic Enhancement and Relief Act or the CHIPPER Act

This bill extends the 11.5% increase to the enhanced Federal Medical Assistance Percentage (FMAP) that is otherwise applicable under the Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP) through FY2021, in accordance with specified conditions. For example, in order to receive the increased FMAP in FY2021, a state must cover, without cost-sharing, testing and treatment for COVID-19 (i.e., coronavirus disease 2019), including vaccines, specialized equipment, and therapies.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: CHIPPER Act

item.title: Children's Health Insurance Program Pandemic Enhancement and Relief Act

item.title: CHIPPER Act
To increase support for State Children's Health Insurance programs during the COVID-19 emergency, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
